# Task

Given a DataFrame `df` with column `dt` representing DateTimes. Write a function `add_yearmonth` that creates a new column `ym` by extracting year and month from `dt` and concatenating them together as an integer in format: “yyyymm”.



# Data

df = DataFrame(dt=[DateTime(2020, 5, 24), DateTime(2021, 1, 15), DateTime(2022, 12, 5)])
add_yearmonth(df)

Here is a solution using Julia. We'll first create the function `add_yearmonth` that extracts year and month from DateTime column `dt`, and then creates a new column `ym`.

```julia
using DataFrames, Dates

function add_yearmonth(df::DataFrame)
    df[:ym] = map(x -> format(x, "yyyymm"), df[:dt]) 
end
```
You can call this function with your DataFrame `df` like so: `add_yearmonth(df)`. Now you'll have a new column `ym` in your DataFrame.

Please note that `format(x, "yyyymm")` gives us the DateTime `x` in the format "yyyymm". The map function applies this operation to each element of the date-time vector.
